text:
Did anyone get a chance to check out the new Sussman book? Seems like the book is almost an advertisement for Julia
<https://www.amazon.com/Software-Design-Flexibility-Programming-Yourself/dp/0262045494>

elements.text: Did anyone get a chance to check out the new Sussman book? Seems like the book is almost an advertisement for Julia

text: the first third or so build up to multiple dispatch and compiling it. There is also stuff in there called "layered data" which amounts to Cassette passes that carry metadata (obviously this works much better in scheme), but then pretty much the rest is based on first class continuations... So if you read it you'll really wish Julia had call/cc

root.text:
Did anyone get a chance to check out the new Sussman book? Seems like the book is almost an advertisement for Julia
<https://www.amazon.com/Software-Design-Flexibility-Programming-Yourself/dp/0262045494>

elements.text: Did anyone get a chance to check out the new Sussman book? Seems like the book is almost an advertisement for Julia

the first third or so build up to multiple dispatch and compiling it. There is also stuff in there called "layered data" which amounts to Cassette passes that carry metadata (obviously this works much better in scheme), but then pretty much the rest is based on first class continuations... So if you read it you'll really wish Julia had call/cc

text: The book is on my wish list. Should I get it now?

elements.text: The book is on my wish list. Should I get it now?

text: it's a good book, if you can afford it, you should try it.

elements.text: it's a good book, if you can afford it, you should try it.

text: I'm very happy with it and thank you for the high level summary Shashi - gave me good material to Google
